html.main:
Core API¶

lux.core.app.execute_from_config(config_file, argv=None, **params)[source]¶

Create and run an App from a config_file.

This is the function to use when creating the script which runs your web applications:

import lux

if __name__ == '__main__':
    lux.execute_from_config('path.to.config')
Parameters:config_file – the python dotted path to the config file for setting up a new App. The config file should be located in the python module which implements the main application of the web site.
class lux.core.app.App(config_file, script=None, argv=None, **params)[source]¶

Extension¶

class lux.core.extension.Extension[source]¶

Base class for lux extensions including App.

meta¶

The ExtensionMeta data created by the Extension metaclass.

logger¶

The logger instance for this Extension.

middleware(app)[source]¶

Called by application app when creating the middleware.

This method is invoked the first time App.handler attribute is accessed. It must return a list of WSGI middleware or None.

response_middleware(app)[source]¶

Called by application app when creating the response middleware

setup_logger(config, opts)[source]¶

Called by setup() method to setup the logger.

setup(module, params, opts=None)[source]¶

Internal method which prepare the extension for usage.

extra_form_data(request)[source]¶

Must return an iterable over key-value pair of data to add to a Form.

By default it returns an empty tuple.

write(msg='', stream=None)[source]¶

Write msg into stream or sys.stdout

write_err(msg='', stream=None)[source]¶

Write msg into stream or sys.stderr

Extension Meta¶

class lux.core.extension.ExtensionMeta(file, version, config=None)[source]¶

Contains metadata for an Extension.

config¶

Dictionary of configuration Parameter for the extension.

script¶

Set at runtime by execute(), it is the script name which runs the application.

version¶

Extension version number (specified via the Extension version class attribute).

media_dir[source]¶

Directory containing media files (if available)

Parameter¶

class lux.core.extension.Parameter(name, default, doc)[source]¶

Class for defining a lux parameter within a lux Extension.

Parameters are specified when creating an Extension in a declarative style (as class attributes of the extension). For example:

from lux import Extension, Parameter

class MyExtension(Extension):
    title = Parameter('Hello', 'The title to use in the home page')
Parameters:
  • default – the default value of the parameter. This is the value used by the framework when the parameter is not found in the config file.
  • doc – a documentation string for the parameter.

Parameters are case insensitive.

The lux.core module contains all the functionalities to run a web site or an rpc server using lux and pulsar_.

ConsoleParser¶

class lux.core.commands.ConsoleParser[source]¶

A class for parsing the console inputs.

Used as base class for both Command and App

Command¶

class lux.core.commands.Command(name, app, stdout=None, stderr=None)[source]¶

Signature class for lux commands. A Command is never created directly, instead, the App.get_command() method is used.

A command is executed via its callable method.

name¶

Command name, given by the module name containing the Command.

app¶

The App running this Command.

stdout¶

The file object corresponding to the output streams of this command.

Default: sys.stdout

stderr¶

The file object corresponding to the error streams of this command.

Default: sys.stderr

get_version()[source]¶

Return the Command version.

By default it is the same version as lux.

run(argv, **params)[source]¶

Run this Command.

This is the only method which needs implementing by subclasses.

run_until_complete(options, **params)[source]¶

Execute the run() method using pulsar asynchronous engine.

Most commands are run using this method.

write(stream='')[source]¶

Write stream to the stdout.

write_err(stream='')[source]¶

Write stream to the stderr.

The Template defines a family of classes which can be used to build HTML elements in a pythonic fashion. No template specific language is required, instead a template for an html element is created by adding children Template to a parent one.

Template¶

class lux.core.templates.Template(*children, **parameters)[source]¶

A factory of Html objects.

>>> simple = Template(Context('foo', tag='span'), tag='div')
>>> html = simple(cn='test', context={'foo': 'bla'})
>>> html.render()
<div class='test'><span data-context='foo'>bla</span></div>
tag¶

An optional HTML tag for the outer element of this template. If not specified, this template is a container of other templates and no outer element is rendered.

key¶

An optional string which identify this Template within other templates. It is also used for extracting content from the context dictionary passed to the template callable method.

children¶

List of Template objects which are rendered as children of this Template

parameters¶

An attribute dictionary containing all key-valued parameters passed during initialisation. These parameters are used when building an Html element via the callable method.

it is initialised by the init_parameters() method at the end of initialisation.

init_parameters(tag=None, classes=None, **parameters)[source]¶

Called at the and of initialisation.

It fills the parameters attribute. It can be overwritten to customise behaviour.

keys()[source]¶

Generator of keys in this Template

get(key)[source]¶

Retrieve a children Template with Template.key equal to key.

The search is done recursively and the first match is returned. If not available return None.

post_process_child(html, child, request, context)[source]¶

Called just before adding child to html

Context¶

class lux.core.templates.Context(key, *children, **params)[source]¶

A Template which enforces the key attribute.

Fore example:

>>> from lux import Context
>>> template = Context('foo', tag='div')
>>> template.key
'foo'
>>> html = template(context={'foo': 'pippo'})
>>> html.render()
<div>pippo</div>

Page Template¶

class lux.core.templates.PageTemplate(*children, **params)[source]¶

A Template to render the inner part of the HTML body tag.

A page template is created by including the page components during initialisation, for example:

from lux.extensions.cms.grid import PageTemplate

head_body_foot = PageTemplate(
    Template(...),
    GridTemplate(...),
    ...)

Grid Template¶

class lux.core.templates.GridTemplate(*children, **params)[source]¶

A container of RowTemplate or other templates.

Parameters:fixed – optional boolean flag to indicate if the grid is fixed (html class grid fixed) or fluid (html class grid fluid). If not specified the grid is considered fluid (it changes width when the browser window changes width).

Row Template¶

class lux.core.templates.RowTemplate(*children, **params)[source]¶

A RowTemplate is a container of ColumnTemplate elements. It should be placed inside a GridTemplate for better rendering.

Parameters:column – Optional parameter which set the column attribute.
column¶

It can be either 12 or 24 and it indicates the number of column spans available.

Default: 12

Column Template¶

class lux.core.templates.ColumnTemplate(*children, **params)[source]¶

A template to place inside a RowTemplate.

Parameters:
  • span=1 – fraction indicating how much this template extend across its row container. For example 0.5 is half span. Must be between 0 and 1.
  • device=’md’ –

    The device which render the column with the correct span. Valid options are

    • xs extra small (phones)
    • sm small (tablets)
    • md medium (desktops)
    • lg large (desktops)
